body: Curious that this doesn't show up in CI.

issue.title: openssl: fix out of scope variables in goto

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Some of the 'goto fail' situations could happen without having initialized the local variables referenced in the error code flow.

Reported-by: Marcel Raad
Fixes #16246

body: Indeed curious that none of the CI jobs spotted this. Can you check if #16251 does the job?

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

body: Works for me, thanks! I have just created https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/16252 to see if that shows the same warning for GCC, so we might want to wait for its builds to run before merging your PR.

It does catch the issue :-)

https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/13209540241/job/36880307494?pr=16252
```

vtls/openssl.c:1462:11: error: jump skips variable initialization [-Werror=jump-misses-init]

vtls/openssl.c:14[86](https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/13209540241/job/36880307494?pr=16252#step:19:87):12: note: 'cert_bio' declared here
 1486 |       BIO *cert_bio = NULL;
      |            ^~~~~~~~
```

Our end of the warnings seems to be working correctly (after double checking
them).

One suspect is OpenSSL configuration. It's kind of hard to tell what options 
do vcpkg and AppVeyor use in their OpenSSL builds, let alone figuring out 
the build defaults.

This curl codepath needs the OpenSSL **UI feature**. So I [added](https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/16238/commits/a88cbbec035b606044a83b2ef148a5e5ad6f080a) an `#error`
there and sure enough, it's not hit either:

https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/13210670321/job/36883398358
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/curlorg/curl/builds/51476216

It looks like vcpkg/AppVeyor OpenSSL binaries do not have UI enabled, which
would make sense because in a headless CI env, a UI popup hangs the job.

This also explains why I [bumped](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/5f2fd0b63a02f9df0ac730c5075f7aab2a245dbf) into these warnings with iOS and the Carthage
OpenSSL build, which must have left UI enabled.

edit: ~~to give it a CI test, we may force-enable this section and add the necessary
OpenSSL functions as stubs.~~ UI is enabled in our custom quictls build in GHA/http3-linux.
